title.narrative: Rapid emergency response to the new recently IDPs in the north of Syria

description.narrative: The people in NWS are facing a massive displacement wave, the statistics of OCHA is mentioning that more than 800,000 people have been displaced from their homes to search for a safer place to their lives Women, children, people with disabilities are the most vulnerable age groups that are at risk related to the inability to access the life-saving needs, not to mention the need to secure an adequate shelter. Adequate shelter is the main concern for those IDPs, it goes without saying that the areas that receive this displacements are currently missing the adequate shelters due to the current high number of IDPs in it, also these areas are rural areas and the number of the buildings that can receive the IDPs is very limited These factors forced the IDPs to reside in self-established camps in a situation that disable them to ensure the basic needs and this was a burden on the humanitarian responsibilities to ensure providing assistance in an effective manner. SECD aims to support 10678 person (3060 in the camp and 7618 person in Merimin (4589 of them are new IDPs and the others are vulnerable host community) identified a suitable place to ensure a cost-effective, sustainable intervention by establishing an environmental-friendly planned camp (No septic tanks – Trees conservation – using the solar power) which ensures the dignity, protection and the access to the basic needs The proposed land is characterized by many factors that support the establishment of the camp: -The location is public land, in a safe area, away from the military actions and near to the Turkish borders -The land is located within a picturesque natural environment, which gave Psychological comfort and the possibility of recovering from the difficult conditions that faced them. -The host people are hospitalized and cooperative and are facing difficulty to deal with the major displacements. -The proposed land is near to five communities (Qirmida-Matleh-Mreimin-Alshamra-Alfauri) which enable the IDPs to access to the local market, public facilities and schools easily and gave them the opportunity to find the livelihoods which are an important factor for improving their living conditions. The nearest community to the location is Mreimin, is hosting more than 4589 new IDPs, these high number is a burden on the local council and it is critical to ensure the access to water for those people since there is a gap in this, the intervention will focus on guaranteeing the social cohesion by supporting the community and provide the cost-effective solution for delivering the water through the network for both the camp and the community. The intervention will be implemented as an emergency response, the priority will be given to accelerate the implementation with ensuring the quality response to support the people as quickly as possible with adhering the respective standards of CCCM cluster and SPHERE in all the activities which are: Leveling the campsite and Graveling the roads and between the tents about 65000 M2 Installing and isolating the ground of 510 tents Conducting of 50 Ramps for PWD Conducting of 2700 ML of drain and sewer lines. Conducting the water network of the camp and connecting it to the water network of Merimin Water trucking to camp residents for 4-6 weeks until the completion of connecting the water network to the camp . Constructing of 20 latrine blocks ( 8 cells). Installing of 60 solar lighting panels and 1800 ML of fence. Establishing the camp management committee Conducting of 25 fire points. Distribution of 700 complementary hygiene kits and consumable kits ( two rounds) Provision of 60 water tanks (2 M3) Supporting solid waste management for both community and camp by providing 260 garbage bins and supporting transportation and workers' costs. Supporting the operational costs of the water station of Mreimin to deliver water to the camp and to the community which is overcrowded with the displaced.
